items.title: Test fails for autocrlf config
items.body:
I've cloned the latest code to my machine and run the test suite by `python setup.py test`. Then I encountered 5 failures:

```bash
======================================================================
FAIL: test_encoding_param (tests.test_parser.TestUnidiffParser)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\users\cirq\desktop\python-unidiff\tests\test_parser.py", line 69, in test_encoding_param
    self.assertEqual(added_unicode_line.value, 'holá mundo!\n')
AssertionError: 'holá mundo!\r\n' != 'holá mundo!\n'
- holá mundo!
?            -
+ holá mundo!


======================================================================
FAIL: test_no_newline_at_end_of_file (tests.test_parser.TestUnidiffParser)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\users\cirq\desktop\python-unidiff\tests\test_parser.py", line 83, in test_no_newline_at_end_of_file
    self.assertEqual(added_unicode_line.value, ' No newline at end of file\n')
AssertionError: ' No newline at end of file\r\n' != ' No newline at end of file\n'
-  No newline at end of file
?                           -
+  No newline at end of file


======================================================================
FAIL: test_parse_sample (tests.test_parser.TestUnidiffParser)
Parse sample file.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\users\cirq\desktop\python-unidiff\tests\test_parser.py", line 135, in test_parse_sample
    self.assertEqual(res[0][0].section_header, 'Section Header')
AssertionError: 'Section Header\r' != 'Section Header'
?               -
+ Section Header

======================================================================
FAIL: test_print_hunks_without_gaps (tests.test_parser.TestUnidiffParser)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\users\cirq\desktop\python-unidiff\tests\test_parser.py", line 114, in test_print_hunks_without_gaps
    self.assertEqual(lines[12], '@@ -5,16 +11,10 @@')
AssertionError: '@@ -5,16 +11,10 @@ ' != '@@ -5,16 +11,10 @@'
- @@ -5,16 +11,10 @@
?                   -
+ @@ -5,16 +11,10 @@


======================================================================
FAIL: test_samples (tests.test_parser.TestVCSSamples)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\users\cirq\desktop\python-unidiff\tests\test_parser.py", line 329, in test_samples
    self.assertEqual(diff_file.read(), str(res))
AssertionError: "=== [127 chars],4 @@\r\n+This was missing!\r\n+Adding it now.[666 chars]\r\n" != "=== [127 chars],4 @@ \r\n+This was missing!\r\n+Adding it now[655 chars]le\n"
Diff is 1139 characters long. Set self.maxDiff to None to see it.

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 32 tests in 0.021s

FAILED (failures=5)
Test failed: <unittest.runner.TextTestResult run=32 errors=0 failures=5>
error: Test failed: <unittest.runner.TextTestResult run=32 errors=0 failures=5>
```

It seems that my git local config has the option `core.autocrlf` to be `True`, hence the test samples are appended with CRLF line ending (i.e., `\r\n`). This auto line ending fixing breaks the assertion.

Is this a bug of the library?

items.title: Allow gracefully removing lines from a patch
items.body:
For viewing purposes, I'd like to be able to remove added lines from diff hunks. This works fine with some iterating and pop'ing the lists, but that doesn't update the metadata so the added/removed lines count is wrong.

I'd like to request that aside from append(), other operations that remove from the list are also implemented to update the metadata. This may extend over just lines to other classes.

items.title: 0.5.2 missing from PyPi
items.body:
Hi,

Having issues installed unidiff 0.5.2 from pypi. It is shown as a release https://pypi.org/project/unidiff/0.5.2/, but no files associated with it thus pip can't install. 


https://pypi.org/simple/unidiff/

Thanks!

items.title: Add examples for using unidiff with python3.x in quickstart
unidiff.errors.UnidiffParseError: Hunk is shorter than expected
items.body:
Hi, for one particular diff I'm getting this error and I'm not sure why. I don't know if this is a bug in unidiff or a bug in my code.

In my tool the error is happening at https://github.com/guykisel/inline-plz/blob/master/inlineplz/interfaces/github.py#L66

Stack trace:
```
...
  File "/home/jenkins/workspace/static-analysis/static-analysis/temp/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/inlineplz/interfaces/github.py", line 66, in __init__
    self.patch = unidiff.PatchSet(self.diff.split('\n'))
  File "/home/jenkins/workspace/static-analysis/static-analysis/temp/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/unidiff/patch.py", line 353, in __init__
    self._parse(data, encoding=encoding)
  File "/home/jenkins/workspace/static-analysis/static-analysis/temp/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/unidiff/patch.py", line 399, in _parse
    current_file._parse_hunk(line, diff, encoding)
  File "/home/jenkins/workspace/static-analysis/static-analysis/temp/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/unidiff/patch.py", line 277, in _parse_hunk
    raise UnidiffParseError('Hunk is shorter than expected')
unidiff.errors.UnidiffParseError: Hunk is shorter than expected
```

items.title: Tests missing from 0.5.5 source tarball
items.body:
The following files are missing from the 0.5.5 tarball (compared with previous tarballs):

```
tests/__init__.py
tests/test_hunks.py
tests/test_parser.py
tests/test_patchedfile.py
```

The test sample files are still there, from #23, it's just the test *code* which is missing this time around.

I suspect it could be due to the removal of `test_suite='tests'` from setup.py in 0.5.5, but honestly setuptools just makes me confused and angry every time I look at it so I'm not sure if that's right.

items.title: Recent build breakage from 0.5.4 -> 0.5.5
items.body:
Hi :)

Recently our master branch CI failed due to the latest upgrade of `unidiff` to 0.5.5:

https://travis-ci.org/coala/coala/jobs/325392018#L754

Suddenly this occured:

```
E           unidiff.errors.UnidiffParseError: Hunk is shorter than expected
```

The test case tests how our own `Diff` class parses unified-diffs, using `unidiff`.

items.title: release 0.5.5 with support for patch_info?
items.body:
unidiff is great, and the recent addition of patch_info super useful.

Any plan to release a new version on pip?

items.title: Hunk.__str__ and Patch.__str__ don't produce usable hunks or patches
items.body: Currently, these methods join their objects' contents with an empty string, and the string returned by ``Line.__str__`` does not end with a newline. That means converting, eg., a ``Patch`` to a string results in all the lines of the patch run together with no newlines between. I can't use that. Either ``Line.__str__`` should append a newline, or the other ``__str__`` methods should join with ``'\n'`` and not ``''``.

items.title: Attribute encode error for Line class
items.body:
I'm getting an error when effectively executing repr on a Line object (explicitly or implicitly).
>>> record = patch[0]
>>> hunk1_sl = list(record[0].source_lines())
>>> str(hunk1_sl[0])
' /build/'
>>> repr(hunk1_sl[0])
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/unidiff/patch.py", line 76, in __repr__
  File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/unidiff/patch.py", line 49, in <lambda>
AttributeError: 'Line' object has no attribute 'encode'
>>> hunk1_sl[0]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/unidiff/patch.py", line 76, in __repr__
  File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/unidiff/patch.py", line 49, in <lambda>
AttributeError: 'Line' object has no attribute 'encode'

Should:

`class Line(object):
    def __repr__(self):
        return make_str("<Line: %s>") % make_str(self)
`
Be:

`class Line(object):
    def __repr__(self):
        return make_str("<Line: %s>") % make_str(self.value)
`
Cheers.

items.title: Add patch position
items.body:
Hello! I have a feature request for you: adding patch position to a line.

"Patch position" is, admittedly, not an official diff term. But it's something [GitHub uses in their API when making PR comments](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/comments/#input). Users aren't actually commenting on a line by its line number in GitHub. Instead, their really commenting on the position of the line in a diff.

items.title: put project on PyPI
items.body:
#10 was never completed, the project is not installable with pip

you should do:

```
python3 -m venv /tmp/unidff
source /tmp/unidiff/bin/activate
pip install -U pip setuptools wheel
python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel upload
```

items.title: git diff `rename from XXX rename to YYY` synthax is not support
items.body:
For example:

``` lang=diff
diff --git a/data/pitivi.desktop.in.in b/data/pitivi.desktop.in
similarity index 100%
rename from data/pitivi.desktop.in.in
rename to data/pitivi.desktop.in
```

will not be taken into account.

items.title: New release including performance improvements?
items.body:
Hi, Unidiff is great! I'm using it in https://github.com/guykisel/inline-plz and it makes my life much easier.

In https://github.com/matiasb/python-unidiff/pull/16 there were some nice performance optimizations, but the release on PyPI doesn't appear to include them. I would be very grateful if you could put up a new release of your package including the improvements.

items.title: unicode problem
items.body:
Hi, I just repeated your tutorial with the latest from pip and it fails with the following URL (that diff has a unicode character):

```
import urllib2
from unidiff import PatchSet
diff = urllib2.urlopen('https://github.com/ros/rosdistro/pull/6619.diff')
patch = PatchSet(diff)
```

/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/unidiff/patch.pyc in **str**(self)
     75 
     76     def **str**(self):
---> 77         return "%s%s" % (self.line_type, self.value)
     78 
     79     @property

UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc3 in position 8: ordinal not in range(128)

Thx

items.title: put project on PyPI
items.body:
I just stumbled onto this project while looking for unified diff parsers, and it looks like it'll fit the bill. My one suggestion is to put the project on [PyPI](https://pypi.python.org/pypi) for simpler installation/updating (e.g., `pip install python-unidiff`). I know you can install with pip using this repo (e.g., `pip install git+https://github.com/matiasb/python-unidiff.git`), but PyPI is nice for installing specific versions of a project if necessary.

Thanks!

items.title: Tag the 0.1 release
items.body: Can you please tag this as the 0.1 release?  Thanks.

items.title: Hi, how would you compare this with python-patch?
Feature request: Store some indication of what lines have been added or removed in the hunk object
items.body:
I am trying to use this library to write a pre commit validation tool that checks spaces in added lines, but I found no way to figure out, from the target lines, which are context and which are actually added.

It would be great if this could be obtained somehow from the library.

Thanks.
